course.title: The Complete JavaScript Course 2021: From Zero to Expert!
course.subtitle: The modern JavaScript course for everyone! Master JavaScript with projects, challenges and theory. Many courses in one!

reviews.body: Jonas has really outdone himself with this course, especially the revamped version. It's incredibly thorough and easy to follow, with amazing visual representations of processes that, up until this point, I was having trouble grasping. Jonas' organized, visual approach really helped me to wrap my head around JavaScript once and for all. So much appreciation for his knowledge, dedication, and consistent improvement.

Love the pace of this course. The instructions and guidance are clear and easy to understand. I always thought learning JavaScript would be an uphill battle, but spending an hour everyday before work watching these videos has helped me improve very quickly ?

I really really love this course. The instructor is very concise about the lectures. He doesn't go off topic and explains everything in very clear and easy to understand way. I cannot see how you could possibly go wrong choosing this course. It has been by far the most helpful Javascript course I have seen so far in my two yrs of learning the language. I wish there were courses about other topics such as mysql and node.js made by this guy because he is truly a great teacher. Would recommend to anyone

Great course with lots of project, covers all the basics and well more, very well explained

On the bad side hardy any questions I have asked in the Q&A section has been acknowledged/answered by the instructor or any teaching assistant.

Thank you Jonas, for updating the course. This course is really the most complete JS course to get you into a job.

I really love your teaching style and course really has a good flow.

I'm so glad that I bought this and all your front-end and back-end courses.

I had some development experience before (backend) and I wanted to really learn JavaScript and I must tell you, this is the best JavaScript course on the internet period. It has everything you need to get you up to speed and more!!! Apart from innovative challenges and awesome projects, what I personally really admired was the fact that Jonas really took a lot of effort in explaining "How JS works under the hood" and that is the most precious thing in this course, and just what I wanted.

The course is comprehensive, it was designed and organized very well, it produces not only the concepts and knowledge but also the experience and skills of Mr. Schmedtmann. Many thanks to him in mixing the theoretical with rich real life projects which are a good motivation to learn more and keep sticking with the learning journey. With such a professional structured course anyone can make his/her way into business as soon as finishing this course. I highly recommended this course for everyone, you can find everything you want in Javascript from beginner to expert.

Very interesting course, I really learned a lot even if I know already JS !!!

The most important is that Jonas gives a lot of tips

Many thanks Jonas

This course is well put together, i'm really enjoying it. I have been using JavaScript without really knowing it so like using stack overflow and site's like it, but that has limited me in what i can do so i thought i would take this course and i have to say it has spark a new love for JavaScript. In short i love this course, and the instructor is exceptional, i would really recommended this course to anyone interested in learning and delving deep into JavaScript.

Going into this course, I had decent javascript knowledge: I partially finished an Angular course more than one year ago and in the last three months I've been working on a UI5 (JS framework) web app.

This course simply brought my overall javascript knowledge and understanding to a whole new higher level. I found some parts of the Fundamentals and Array sections just a bit boring since many of the content was very familiar but I still enjoyed these sections because they filled many knowledge gaps I had.

I changed my opinion about pure javascript (vanilla, as people call it), it's amazing what one can develop using plain javascript, HTML and css. I strongly feel now that I should start a node Node course or an Advanced javascript course next, but I would also like to develop a similar understanding on css and HTML.

It is a great course! I already knew some basic knowledge of JS, but this course improved my knowledge a lot! I like that there are a lot of small assignments given before starting to build bigger websites. Thanks Jonas!

The videos are much longer compared to the other courses I took but that's because Jonas is always explaining every little detail of the process and also repeats the explanations throughout the course that helps in memory reenforcement.

Thank you again for a wonderful course Jonas! ?

instructor.name: Jonas Schmedtmann
instructor.briefIntroduction:
Hi, I'm Jonas! I have been identified as one of Udemy's Top Instructors and all my premium courses have recently earned the best-selling status for outstanding performance and student satisfaction.

I'm a full-stack web developer and designer with a passion for building beautiful things from scratch. I've been building websites and apps since 2007 and also have a Master's degree in Engineering.

It was in college where I first discovered my passion for teaching and helping others by sharing all I knew. And that passion brought me to Udemy in 2015, where my students love the fact that I take the time to explain important concepts in a way that everyone can easily understand.

Do you want to learn how to build awesome websites with advanced HTML and CSS?

Looking for a complete JavaScript course that takes you from beginner to advanced developer?

Or maybe you want to build modern and fast back-end applications with Node.js?

Then don't waste your time with random tutorials or incomplete videos. All my courses are easy-to-follow, all-in-one packages that will take your skills to the next level.

These courses are exactly the courses I wish I had when I was first getting into web development!

So see for yourself, enroll in one of my courses (or all of them :D) and join my 500,000+ happy students today.

unitNames: Migration Guide to v2 + Old Course
JavaScript Releases: ES5, ES6+ and ESNext
Looping Backwards and Loops in Loops
Setting up Prettier and VS Code
Installing Node.js and Setting Up a Dev Environment
How to Think Like a Developer: Become a Problem Solver!
Debugging with the Console and Breakpoints
Introduction to the CSS Box Model

curriculum.sectionName: JavaScript in the Browser: DOM and Events Fundamentals
unitNames: What's the DOM and DOM Manipulation
Refactoring Our Code: The DRY Principle

curriculum.sectionName: How JavaScript Works Behind the Scenes
unitNames: Execution Contexts and The Call Stack
Variable Environment: Hoisting and The TDZ
Primitives vs. Objects (Primitive vs. Reference Types)

curriculum.sectionName: Data Structures, Modern Operators and Strings
unitNames: Looping Objects: Object Keys, Values, and Entries
Summary: Which Data Structure to Use?
How Passing Arguments Works: Value vs. Reference
More Ways of Creating and Filling Arrays
Summary: Which Array Method to Use?
Types of Events and Event Handlers
Implementing a Sticky Navigation: The Scroll Event
A Better Way: The Intersection Observer API
Efficient Script Loading: defer and async
Constructor Functions and the new Operator
Prototypal Inheritance and The Prototype Chain
Encapsulation: Private Class Fields and Methods

curriculum.sectionName: Mapty App: OOP, Geolocation, External Libraries, and More!
unitNames: How to Plan a Web Project
Displaying a Map Using Leaflet Library

curriculum.sectionName: Asynchronous JavaScript: Promises, Async/Await and AJAX
unitNames: [OPTIONAL] How the Web Works: Requests and Responses
Asynchronous Behind the Scenes: The Event Loop
Other Promise Combinators: race, allSettled and any

curriculum.sectionName: Modern JavaScript Development: Modules and Tooling
unitNames: An Overview of Modern JavaScript Development
An Overview of Modules in JavaScript
Exporting and Importing in ES6 Modules
A Brief Introduction to the Command Line

Modern, Clean and Declarative JavaScript Programming

curriculum.sectionName: Forkify App: Building a Modern Application
